CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, March 29, 1952, pg. 28 reads: "Almost Made It - The scrappy Westinghouse High School Bulldogs, city champions, figuratively played their hears out in their loss to Farrell High School's WPIAL champions Wednesday night. Lem Nixon's 24 markers tied the sensational McCoy's total for the evening, and Charles Robinson with 12, and Bill Peatross with 10, aided the Bulldog's cause, but it was just too much McCoy.  It was Farrell which bumped Westinghouse in western Regional PIAA Class A basketball final last year by an almost identical score of 55-54."
TitMainTitle: Group portrait of Westinghouse High School basketball team, including Bill Peatross, Charles Robinson, and Lem Nixon, posed with coach Willard Fisher in interior, another pose
